So yes, that see-saw thing that's always
just what's gonna trip you to pull up.

274
00:13:04.166 --> 00:13:07.439
So just keep practicing with it, you
can kinda see okay, I can go like that,

275
00:13:07.439 --> 00:13:08.371
I can kinda balance.

276
00:13:08.371 --> 00:13:12.521
I can maybe get a little fancy,
start moving these around.

277
00:13:12.521 --> 00:13:15.279
Kinda change the amplitude of this one.

278
00:13:15.279 --> 00:13:19.900
Now, where you change this see saw,
if you will, the direction of the curve.

279
00:13:19.900 --> 00:13:24.292
Every time you change the direction
of one, it goes the other way.

280
00:13:24.292 --> 00:13:25.485
So that see saw method.

281
00:13:25.485 --> 00:13:28.426
Now, you will notice that you don't have
that necessarily with the amplitude.

282
00:13:28.426 --> 00:13:31.139
So just because I make this
one really really long.

283
00:13:31.139 --> 00:13:34.425
This one stays the same length,
so that is something to mention.

284
00:13:34.425 --> 00:13:39.344
Only the direction or that kinda see saw
is what's gonna change the amplitude of it

285
00:13:39.344 --> 00:13:41.781
is gonna stay the same on the other side.

286
00:13:41.781 --> 00:13:45.149
So that's something that
I would point out to you.

287
00:13:45.149 --> 00:13:48.478
And again, just continue to play with it,
continue to practice with it.

288
00:13:48.478 --> 00:13:52.586
Now, there is one thing that I
wanted to point out with this and

289
00:13:52.586 --> 00:13:55.117
we'll just start with a new one here.

290
00:13:55.117 --> 00:13:59.147
The Anchor Point tool, so kinda like what
we've been using with our Add Anchor Point

291
00:13:59.147 --> 00:14:01.044
tool and our Delete Anchor Point tool.

292
00:14:01.044 --> 00:14:03.474
Our Anchor Point tool, oops, excuse me,

293
00:14:03.474 --> 00:14:07.737
will change a straight path just clicking
all kinds of random things here.

294
00:14:07.737 --> 00:14:13.191
Will change a straight path to a curved
path and a curved path to a straight path.

295
00:14:13.191 --> 00:14:15.014
Well, I've already said that,
it flips the two basically.

296
00:14:15.014 --> 00:14:18.642
And so what we'll do here, when I'm
looking at this, it's okay, all right,

297
00:14:18.642 --> 00:14:20.060
what if I have this rectangle?

298
00:14:20.060 --> 00:14:21.571
And I want it to be a curve, but

299
00:14:21.571 --> 00:14:25.457
I don't have a way of making it a curve
because I don't have a Bezier handle.

300
00:14:25.457 --> 00:14:27.947
How do I make that Bezier handle?

301
00:14:27.947 --> 00:14:30.291
That's gonna be through
our Anchor Point tool.

302
00:14:30.291 --> 00:14:32.781
So I'm gonna go ahead here, right
underneath that Delete Anchor Point tool,

303
00:14:32.781 --> 00:14:33.883
it's just the Anchor Point tool.

304
00:14:33.883 --> 00:14:37.167
If you are in an older version,
if you've seen it in an older version,

305
00:14:37.167 --> 00:14:40.972
it used to be called the Convert Anchor
Point tool, they just shortened it on us.

306
00:14:40.972 --> 00:14:44.752
So what we can do here, if I click,
hold, and drag I need to,

307
00:14:44.752 --> 00:14:46.541
I just can't single click.

308
00:14:46.541 --> 00:14:49.628
You can single click on curved path,
but I'm taking a straight path here,

309
00:14:49.628 --> 00:14:50.167
right here.

310
00:14:50.167 --> 00:14:54.723
And I need to click on drag because I need
to create that direction in the amplitude

311
00:14:54.723 --> 00:14:55.465
of my curve.

312
00:14:55.465 --> 00:14:59.821
So if I take this and I click, hold and
drag, you'll see I can go ahead and

313
00:14:59.821 --> 00:15:01.548
create that Bezier handle.

314
00:15:01.548 --> 00:15:04.026
Now, if I go over here,
if I select this one and

315
00:15:04.026 --> 00:15:08.665
then take a path that's already curved, so
I already have these Bezier handles here,

316
00:15:08.665 --> 00:15:10.463
you can kinda see that like that.

317
00:15:10.463 --> 00:15:14.063
If I already have that,
I don't need to click, hold, and drag.

318
00:15:14.063 --> 00:15:18.131
Cuz I don't need to create a Bezier
handle, all I have to do is just click and

319
00:15:18.131 --> 00:15:20.336
that will convert it to a straight path.

320
00:15:20.336 --> 00:15:25.328
So it's kind of just a matter of figuring
out exactly what you'll need, and

321
00:15:25.328 --> 00:15:29.072
I think we'll see if I can
remember how to do it properly.

322
00:15:29.072 --> 00:15:32.191
People always wanna know how to
create a heart in Illustrator.

323
00:15:32.191 --> 00:15:34.466
[LAUGH] There are a couple
different ways to do it.

324
00:15:34.466 --> 00:15:38.968
I have a couple different methods that
I use to do one if I ever need to.

325
00:15:38.968 --> 00:15:41.454
Unfortunately it doesn't
really come up that much,

326
00:15:41.454 --> 00:15:43.506
realistically in professional purposes.

327
00:15:43.506 --> 00:15:45.093
But you always wanna draw it cuz it's fun.

328
00:15:45.093 --> 00:15:47.409
This is one kind of
method that you can do.

329
00:15:47.409 --> 00:15:50.415
I can take this, my circle,
go ahead and start with that.

330
00:15:50.415 --> 00:15:52.641
Click, hold, and drag this down.

331
00:15:52.641 --> 00:15:54.546
Click hold and drag this down.

332
00:15:54.546 --> 00:15:57.093
So you can kinda see okay,
I have the basis of my heart.

333
00:15:57.093 --> 00:15:59.306
Now, one thing that I did here that
I want to kind of point out to you.

334
00:15:59.306 --> 00:16:04.405
I held out my Shift key just to make sure
that would stay kinda perfectly in line.

335
00:16:04.405 --> 00:16:05.904
You don't really have to but

336
00:16:05.904 --> 00:16:09.909
just be aware sometimes those Shift key
options are still available to you.

337
00:16:09.909 --> 00:16:13.130
So I have this okay,
I can kinda take this down, whatever.

338
00:16:13.130 --> 00:16:16.027
You can see it kind of looks like a heart,
we're getting there.

339
00:16:16.027 --> 00:16:19.477
If I take my Anchor Point tool,
single click on the top one,

340
00:16:19.477 --> 00:16:21.341
single click on the bottom one.

341
00:16:21.341 --> 00:16:22.815
So those become a straight path.

342
00:16:22.815 --> 00:16:25.678
It's like wow, it's kinda
getting there a little bit more.

343
00:16:25.678 --> 00:16:29.071
Now, I take my Direct Selection tool or
my White Arrow tool.

344
00:16:29.071 --> 00:16:32.184
You always just kinda get started with
these things and then go back and

345
00:16:32.184 --> 00:16:33.946
edit with your White Arrow tool later.

346
00:16:33.946 --> 00:16:35.417
So I kinda got started here okay,

347
00:16:35.417 --> 00:16:37.899
maybe I'm gonna drug this
guide down a little farther.

348
00:16:37.899 --> 00:16:44.012
Maybe if I wanna take these and kinda
adjust my handlebars or my Bezier handles.

349
00:16:44.012 --> 00:16:46.088
And it's like, okay,
maybe I'll kinda drag that out.

350
00:16:46.088 --> 00:16:49.418
Take this, kinda drag that out.

351
00:16:49.418 --> 00:16:50.255
And, you know what?

352
00:16:50.255 --> 00:16:54.647
This is not the most perfect in the world,
but that was actually a pretty quick and

353
00:16:54.647 --> 00:16:56.142
easy way to create a heart.

354
00:16:56.142 --> 00:16:58.044
I might kinda smooth
those out a little bit,

355
00:16:58.044 --> 00:17:00.262
if I were actually spending
some more time on this.

356
00:17:00.262 --> 00:17:03.593
But if you were curious, quick and
easy, or shouldn't say quick and

357
00:17:03.593 --> 00:17:05.557
easy way to do it, but
it is a way to do it.

358
00:17:05.557 --> 00:17:10.394
>> Yeah, and another thing
that the Convert Anchor Point,

359
00:17:10.394 --> 00:17:15.348
sorry, the Anchor Point showed us,
the see saw, right?

360
00:17:15.348 --> 00:17:18.573
When we had our see saw,
you said it will always go, like this.

361
00:17:18.573 --> 00:17:22.701
Well, the convert anchor point
tool will also break the see saw.

362
00:17:22.701 --> 00:17:27.417
So, where you can have one act
differently than the other.

363
00:17:27.417 --> 00:17:30.379
Which again,
like if you are on that side of the heart.

364
00:17:30.379 --> 00:17:32.308
If you don't mind if I,
I'm also directing you again.

365
00:17:32.308 --> 00:17:33.413
[LAUGH]
>> Yeah, I like it.

366
00:17:33.413 --> 00:17:36.500
>> If you take the White Arrow tool,
and we go to that one, and

367
00:17:36.500 --> 00:17:37.705
just grab that point.

368
00:17:37.705 --> 00:17:42.296
If we go to either end of the see saw,
it's gonna change the other one.

369
00:17:42.296 --> 00:17:46.550
But if we have that still selected,
go to the convert, sorry,

370
00:17:46.550 --> 00:17:50.804
Anchor Point tool, now you grab
the end of it, now you can see,

371
00:17:50.804 --> 00:17:56.130
it breaks the seesaw so that's when it
gets, when I teach this that top point.

372
00:17:56.130 --> 00:17:58.555
I don't make it a straight point,

373
00:17:58.555 --> 00:18:02.580
I use that to break it to give
it a little bit more control.

374
00:18:02.580 --> 00:18:06.686
Cuz that where it kinda
goes to V that way.

375
00:18:06.686 --> 00:18:10.772
So just another option
of breaking the see saw,

376
00:18:10.772 --> 00:18:11.377
>> Yeah.

377
00:18:11.377 --> 00:18:12.364
>> For the use of the convert.

378
00:18:12.364 --> 00:18:14.121
You can't do that with
the white arrow tool,

379
00:18:14.121 --> 00:18:15.565
it has to be the convert anchor tool.

380
00:18:15.565 --> 00:18:18.522
>> Yeah, I think that,
I'm really glad you mentioned that.

381
00:18:18.522 --> 00:18:20.250
Cuz that's something I always
think of with the pen tool.

382
00:18:20.250 --> 00:18:22.758
For some reason I'm just Working
with the white arrow tool it doesn't

383
00:18:22.758 --> 00:18:23.403
ever occur to me.

384
00:18:23.403 --> 00:18:26.152
But yes if for
some reason you need to break that,

385
00:18:26.152 --> 00:18:28.109
my heart looks a little wonky now.

386
00:18:28.109 --> 00:18:32.383
You can use the Anchor Point tool,
so you do have the option.

387
00:18:32.383 --> 00:18:35.212
We kinda tell you that it's a see saw and
that's the only way to go, and it's like,

388
00:18:35.212 --> 00:18:36.155
well, okay, not really.

389
00:18:36.155 --> 00:18:39.231
You do have the option with
your Anchor Point tool there.

390
00:18:39.231 --> 00:18:41.923
So, I would say let's go ahead and
stop there.

391
00:18:41.923 --> 00:18:45.955
Give you some time to kinda practice and
keep working with this especially,

392
00:18:45.955 --> 00:18:50.372
working with your curved paths since those
are gonna be a little more challenging.

393
00:18:50.372 --> 00:18:53.917
Take your Bezier handles and
assess how those work and

394
00:18:53.917 --> 00:18:57.080
then we'll come back and do the Pen tool.

395
00:18:57.080 --> 00:18:58.265
>> The pen tool.

396
00:18:58.265 --> 00:18:58.833
>> Yeah.

397
00:18:58.833 --> 00:19:01.548
>> Yes, but I use these all the time.

398
00:19:01.548 --> 00:19:02.266
>> Yeah.
>> Yeah,

399
00:19:02.266 --> 00:19:04.510
because again you kinda
start with something.

400
00:19:04.510 --> 00:19:09.478
Instead of going right to the pen tool and
doing it from scratch,

401
00:19:09.478 --> 00:19:14.906
a lot of times I can take a square,
or a circle, and add and subtract and

402
00:19:14.906 --> 00:19:20.150
break and move and do all these kinds
of things to end up with a heart or

403
00:19:20.150 --> 00:19:23.190
some weird shape that I'm going to do.

404
00:19:23.190 --> 00:19:27.451
Because I can just go ahead and use those
and just avoid the pen tool altogether.

405
00:19:27.451 --> 00:19:29.983
And then a lot of time I'm like
it's not doing what I wanna do,

406
00:19:29.983 --> 00:19:32.300
I'm just gonna go to the pen tool and
do it from scratch.

407
00:19:32.300 --> 00:19:36.331
[LAUGH] But that was a great episode,
great concept,

408
00:19:36.331 --> 00:19:39.822
core concepts of how to
edit points on a path.

409
00:19:39.822 --> 00:19:41.007
>> All right; yehey.

410
00:19:41.007 --> 00:19:43.765
>> Fun, so lets go ahead and
wrap it on up.

411
00:19:43.765 --> 00:19:45.939
We're gonna sign off for CreativePro.TV.

412
00:19:45.939 --> 00:19:46.968
I've been your host Vonne Smith.

413
00:19:46.968 --> 00:19:48.291
>> And I'm Emily Ramsey.

414
00:19:48.291 --> 00:19:49.046
>> And we'll see you soon.

415
00:19:49.046 --> 00:19:55.054
[SOUND]

episodes.description: The pen tool is one of the most important tools in Illustrator. In this episode, Emily and Vonne demonstrate how to master the pen tool to create straight and curved paths.
episodes.title: The Pen Tool
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.008 --> 00:00:06.445
[SOUND]

2
00:00:06.445 --> 00:00:11.202
[MUSIC]

3
00:00:11.202 --> 00:00:15.530
Hello, everyone and welcome back to
another great edition of CreativeProTV.

4
00:00:15.530 --> 00:00:21.050
I'm your host Vonne Smith and we're
continuing on with IllustratorCC2017 and

5
00:00:21.050 --> 00:00:24.320
this is the pen tool.

6
00:00:24.320 --> 00:00:25.890
Yes.
>> You have to sing it.

7
00:00:25.890 --> 00:00:28.198
You can't not sing it.

8
00:00:28.198 --> 00:00:33.570
>> I know and Miss Emily Ramsey is
here to help us with the pen tool and

9
00:00:33.570 --> 00:00:35.980
I know we're both excited about this tool.

10
00:00:35.980 --> 00:00:37.557
>> Yeah, yeah well the pen tool.

11
00:00:37.557 --> 00:00:39.760
The pen tool is just always
the thing people think of.

12
00:00:39.760 --> 00:00:43.740
I mean it's like this big dramatic
moment when you're finally unveiling it

13
00:00:43.740 --> 00:00:48.100
cuz it's always what people hear about or
we talk about or whatever so.

14
00:00:48.100 --> 00:00:49.840
I'm excited.

15
00:00:49.840 --> 00:00:54.290
So what the pen tool does is it's
basically just gonna be kind of our

16
00:00:54.290 --> 00:00:55.110
freehand.

17
00:00:55.110 --> 00:00:58.420
I shouldn't say a freehand drawing tool
cuz that's gonna kinda confuse from

18
00:00:58.420 --> 00:00:59.980
our paint brushes, and things like that.

19
00:00:59.980 --> 00:01:03.200
But we are going to actually
draw with the pen tool.

20
00:01:03.200 --> 00:01:05.280
So we're gonna be creating our own paths.

21
00:01:05.280 --> 00:01:08.230
I can make a closed path,
open path, whatever.

22
00:01:08.230 --> 00:01:12.105
>> And with the pen,
we're talking about pinpoint accuracy,

23
00:01:12.105 --> 00:01:13.930
>> Yes

24
00:01:13.930 --> 00:01:16.800
>> Of actually designating when a point

25
00:01:16.800 --> 00:01:22.260
happens, what does that point do,
and how we can kinda move on.

26
00:01:22.260 --> 00:01:27.610
Because in referencing the freehand, I'm
just drawing this in and it goes ahead and

27
00:01:27.610 --> 00:01:32.150
determines where the points are and
what type of points.

28
00:01:32.150 --> 00:01:36.884
Whether they're curve bezier handles that
we saw in the previous episode here.

29
00:01:36.884 --> 00:01:40.050
And that's actually one
of those things like,

30
00:01:40.050 --> 00:01:42.922
if you start with the pencil or
pen tool, wait no, pencil or brush tool.

31
00:01:42.922 --> 00:01:45.512
>> Uh-hum.
>> With that white arrow that we were

32
00:01:45.512 --> 00:01:48.732
looking at before and
clicked on those points,

33
00:01:48.732 --> 00:01:53.398
you would see the same things that
we saw in like the circle or square,

34
00:01:53.398 --> 00:01:57.040
we just weren't ready to
really tell you about that.

35
00:01:57.040 --> 00:01:57.770
>> Right, right.
[LAUGH]

36
00:01:57.770 --> 00:01:59.390
>> And now we're at the point where

37
00:01:59.390 --> 00:02:01.730
we're gonna go ahead and
use the pen tool to do that.

38
00:02:01.730 --> 00:02:02.670
>> Yeah, exactly.

39
00:02:02.670 --> 00:02:05.520
But I do think a good place
to start with our pen tool

40
00:02:05.520 --> 00:02:07.850
is just a quick review
of our wide area tool.

41
00:02:07.850 --> 00:02:11.630
So what I've done here, I've just created
a straight path and a curved path.

42
00:02:11.630 --> 00:02:12.770
You guys know this.

43
00:02:12.770 --> 00:02:13.430
Okay?

44
00:02:13.430 --> 00:02:15.810
My straight path is gonna
be pretty easy to edit.

45
00:02:15.810 --> 00:02:19.770
I'll go ahead and grab a point and
I can kinda manipulate that point so on.

46
00:02:19.770 --> 00:02:23.870
My curved paths where things get a little
crazy and you have those bezier handles.

47
00:02:23.870 --> 00:02:25.310
Woops, grabbed the whole thing.

48
00:02:25.310 --> 00:02:26.420
Grab our bezier handles.

49
00:02:26.420 --> 00:02:29.330
I'm gonna select that point and you can
see I can move it down and up fine.

50
00:02:29.330 --> 00:02:33.080
But then when I actually move that bezier
handle, it's changing In the direction and

51
00:02:33.080 --> 00:02:34.520
the amplitude of the curve.

52
00:02:34.520 --> 00:02:36.110
So why do I bring this up?

53
00:02:36.110 --> 00:02:39.370
Because those same principles
are gonna apply whether making

54
00:02:39.370 --> 00:02:43.060
a straight path with the pen tool, or
making curved paths with our pen tool, or

55
00:02:43.060 --> 00:02:45.530
certainly blending the two together.

56
00:02:45.530 --> 00:02:47.330
That's why I wanted to go ahead and
bring that up.

57
00:02:47.330 --> 00:02:49.400
Now we can go ahead and delete these.

58
00:02:49.400 --> 00:02:53.310
My advice with the pen tool,
every time, is just one,

59
00:02:53.310 --> 00:02:58.110
you may want to sit back and watch
today and just kind of breathe it in.

60
00:02:58.110 --> 00:03:01.750
Just embrace it, relax, enjoy the,

61
00:03:01.750 --> 00:03:06.770
let the pressure be on me, to go ahead and
do it correctly for you on camera I guess.

62
00:03:06.770 --> 00:03:10.930
So you can go ahead and do that, or
just practice, practice, practice.

63
00:03:10.930 --> 00:03:13.690
Watch me do it once,
then go ahead and do it.

64
00:03:13.690 --> 00:03:16.330
It's not gonna be something
that you pick up in a day.

65
00:03:16.330 --> 00:03:17.350
It's just not.

66
00:03:17.350 --> 00:03:21.210
And I can say we probably, the both of us,
it took us a long time to go ahead and

67
00:03:21.210 --> 00:03:24.690
really master this because it is so
precise.

68
00:03:24.690 --> 00:03:27.480
Which is something that we have
missed in some of the other tools.

69
00:03:27.480 --> 00:03:30.263
>> And I like how you said, like, the
learning by osmosis type of thing [LAUGH].

70
00:03:30.263 --> 00:03:30.870
>> Yeah, yeah [LAUGH].

71
00:03:30.870 --> 00:03:32.280
>> Just watch.

72
00:03:32.280 --> 00:03:34.340
And maybe watch it a couple times.

73
00:03:34.340 --> 00:03:36.360
Maybe even go watch
somebody else do it too.

74
00:03:36.360 --> 00:03:40.530
>> Yeah.
>> We're not the only experts on this.

75
00:03:40.530 --> 00:03:43.060
>> [LAUGH]
>> It does take some kind of

76
00:03:43.060 --> 00:03:44.710
understanding the concepts, then doing.

77
00:03:44.710 --> 00:03:47.270
Because it can be very frustrating.

78
00:03:47.270 --> 00:03:49.110
And that's the whole duh, duh, duh.

79
00:03:49.110 --> 00:03:51.110
My gosh this is a crazy tool.

80
00:03:51.110 --> 00:03:58.570
But just breathe it in like you said and
give it some time and keep practicing.

81
00:03:58.570 --> 00:04:01.645
You will get it, just don't write it off.

82
00:04:01.645 --> 00:04:02.160
>> Yeah.

83
00:04:02.160 --> 00:04:03.250
>> That's my other point.

84
00:04:03.250 --> 00:04:04.540

Is that what I'm thinking?

00:14:36.550 --> 00:14:37.300
>> I don't remember.

310
00:14:37.300 --> 00:14:39.270
It's somewhere in there.

311
00:14:39.270 --> 00:14:41.590
>> We'll figure it out.
>> We'll let you know.

312
00:14:41.590 --> 00:14:42.462
>> So yeah.

313
00:14:42.462 --> 00:14:43.799
>> [LAUGH]
>> I like it, personally.

314
00:14:43.799 --> 00:14:45.661
I mean,
I would never want to take it off, and

315
00:14:45.661 --> 00:14:48.161
that's probably why I would
never have looked it up, yeah.

316
00:14:48.161 --> 00:14:49.629
>> [LAUGH]
>> Yeah, because I'm like,

317
00:14:49.629 --> 00:14:50.757
why is it doing this?

318
00:14:50.757 --> 00:14:55.431
I know it's being helpful, and for
somebody learning, that's great and

319
00:14:55.431 --> 00:14:59.600
I think I came around to it, but
I was like I'm gonna turn this off.

320
00:14:59.600 --> 00:15:01.980
And I did find it somewhere in
the Preferences, so I will-

321
00:15:01.980 --> 00:15:04.558
>> Very bold woman, turn it off!

322
00:15:04.558 --> 00:15:05.370
Like wow!

323
00:15:05.370 --> 00:15:07.224
>> [LAUGH]
>> You don't need to see where

324
00:15:07.224 --> 00:15:09.748
you're going, just draw anywhere!

325
00:15:09.748 --> 00:15:13.978
>> I didn't, [LAUGH] bold is just old.

326
00:15:13.978 --> 00:15:17.240
>> [LAUGH] That was like, no, no, no, no.

327
00:15:17.240 --> 00:15:21.023
You're not,
you're just experienced in Illustrator.

328
00:15:21.023 --> 00:15:21.528
We'll say that.

329
00:15:21.528 --> 00:15:24.830
So yeah, we'll go ahead and
do that again, just to run through it.

330
00:15:24.830 --> 00:15:26.730
I'm gonna start here, start fresh.

331
00:15:26.730 --> 00:15:33.430
Click, hold, and drag up, you'll see that
my path, the Bezier handle's going up.

332
00:15:33.430 --> 00:15:36.080
I'm also seeing that ghosting
that Vonne pointed out.

333
00:15:36.080 --> 00:15:38.020
So now I've seen my little hump going up.

334
00:15:38.020 --> 00:15:42.655
If you wanna get really fancy,
you'll see how when you're drawing these,

335
00:15:42.655 --> 00:15:47.448
see how your Bezier handles can kinda go
a little bit wonky on you if you want to?

336
00:15:47.448 --> 00:15:49.576
They can kinda start
to create some angles,

337
00:15:49.576 --> 00:15:52.287
which is gonna affect the kinda
direction of your hump.

338
00:15:52.287 --> 00:15:56.026
What I tend to do I hold down my
shift key just like anything else,

339
00:15:56.026 --> 00:15:58.870
maintaining those perfect proportions.

340
00:15:58.870 --> 00:16:01.888
And that will kind of keep your bezier
handler from going left and right.

341
00:16:01.888 --> 00:16:05.159
It's gonna keep it at a perfect 90
degree angle, so you can go ahead and

342
00:16:05.159 --> 00:16:06.788
use that as an option if you want to.

343
00:16:06.788 --> 00:16:09.258
But, click hold, I'm gonna let it go.

344
00:16:09.258 --> 00:16:12.160
That's kind of always the key thing too,
I think, with the pen tools.

345
00:16:12.160 --> 00:16:13.530
Knowing when to let go.

346
00:16:13.530 --> 00:16:16.640
So I'm gonna click, hold, and drag.

347
00:16:16.640 --> 00:16:18.170
Now I've let go of my mouse.

348
00:16:19.280 --> 00:16:22.180
Go back up here, click,
hold, drag, let go.

349
00:16:23.240 --> 00:16:26.200
Click, hold, drag, let go.

350
00:16:26.200 --> 00:16:29.460
So that's really kinda
keep doing that until you

351
00:16:29.460 --> 00:16:31.620
feel like you get comfortable with it.

352
00:16:31.620 --> 00:16:33.802
Once you feel like you get
comfortable with that,

353
00:16:33.802 --> 00:16:35.880
we're gonna mix it up a little bit more.

354
00:16:35.880 --> 00:16:37.960
Now we're gonna talk
about changing direction.

355
00:16:37.960 --> 00:16:40.650
So what do I do if I
want to create something.

356
00:16:40.650 --> 00:16:42.030
That was a terrible drawing.

357
00:16:42.030 --> 00:16:45.050
But what do I do if I want to create
something that looks like that?

358
00:16:45.050 --> 00:16:48.055
In that case,
we need to work on our corner points.

359
00:16:48.055 --> 00:16:50.760
So we kind of go back to
those bezier handles.

360
00:16:50.760 --> 00:16:56.130
It's like, wait a second, if I did this
then by default, it wants to go to down.

361
00:16:56.130 --> 00:16:57.220
What do I do?

362
00:16:57.220 --> 00:17:00.970
You remember working with
that anchor point tool,

363
00:17:00.970 --> 00:17:02.530
back when we discussed the white arrow?

364
00:17:02.530 --> 00:17:05.720
This is gonna be kind of similar,
it's really using that.

365
00:17:05.720 --> 00:17:08.990
So if I take my pen tool here,
click, hold, and drag up.

366
00:17:10.620 --> 00:17:13.300
Click hold and drag down, so
I'm gonna started the exact same way.

367
00:17:13.300 --> 00:17:15.175
Now, I've let go of my mouse.

368
00:17:15.175 --> 00:17:17.020
You can see my jazz hands here.

369
00:17:17.020 --> 00:17:20.560
So I've let go of my mouse and
I'm gonna hold down my Alt or Option key.

370
00:17:20.560 --> 00:17:21.700
Option on a Mac.

371
00:17:21.700 --> 00:17:22.375
Alt on a PC.

372
00:17:22.375 --> 00:17:25.015
I'm gonna hold that down and
you're gonna see it's gonna

373
00:17:25.015 --> 00:17:29.655
toggle to that anchor point tool,
so I get that little v coming up.

374
00:17:29.655 --> 00:17:32.595
So I can see that Alt, I can go ahead and
click, hold, and drag.

375
00:17:32.595 --> 00:17:34.765
Now I'm just gonna drag
this little bezier handle,

376
00:17:34.765 --> 00:17:36.030
I'm not messing with the point now.

377
00:17:36.030 --> 00:17:38.220
I'm actually using the bezier handle, and

378
00:17:38.220 --> 00:17:40.180
I'm just gonna drag it
up to meet its friend.

379
00:17:40.180 --> 00:17:44.130
So I'm just placing the two right on
top of each other, is what I'm doing.

380
00:17:44.130 --> 00:17:48.190
And then I am gonna let go of my mouse,
so now I've moved that bezier handle up.

381
00:17:48.190 --> 00:17:51.293
I've created a corner point
to go ahead and meet that.

382
00:17:51.293 --> 00:17:53.173
Now, I'm gonna let go.

383
00:17:53.173 --> 00:17:57.417
Jazz hands, and I'm going to kind of
create a point again, along the same line.

384
00:17:57.417 --> 00:18:00.797
Similar to what we were doing before,
where you were doing the up and down,

385
00:18:00.797 --> 00:18:04.770
up and down, except for now, I'm just
adjusting where my curves are going.

386
00:18:04.770 --> 00:18:07.350
So I've let go of my mouse again.

387
00:18:07.350 --> 00:18:11.762
I'm going to click and hold on my Alt or
Option key, click, hold, and drag that up.

388
00:18:11.762 --> 00:18:14.510
I'm gonna drag this little
guy to meet its friend.

389
00:18:14.510 --> 00:18:17.780
Just place the two right on top
of each other or close to it.

390
00:18:19.360 --> 00:18:22.270
Click, hold, and drag, create a new one.

391
00:18:22.270 --> 00:18:24.280
Let go.
Alt or Option key.

392
00:18:24.280 --> 00:18:26.888
Click, hold, and drag that up.

393
00:18:26.888 --> 00:18:27.552
Let go.

394
00:18:27.552 --> 00:18:28.920
I've let go again.

395
00:18:28.920 --> 00:18:30.850
That's the key one there.

396
00:18:30.850 --> 00:18:32.020
Click, hold, and drag.

397
00:18:32.020 --> 00:18:34.940
And now I can see be like
these aren't perfect.

398
00:18:34.940 --> 00:18:37.130
It's not great, but
I can go back to my white arrow tool.

399
00:18:37.130 --> 00:18:40.800
>> In this it goes back to how
is the point leaving the path.

400
00:18:40.800 --> 00:18:46.900
How is it going into, like thinking ahead,
point one to two, okay, up, down.

401
00:18:46.900 --> 00:18:51.820
But now I have to think point two to point
three, well, it's gotta turn around.

402
00:18:51.820 --> 00:18:57.224
It's gotta leave point two going back up,
so I had to break that direction.

403
00:18:57.224 --> 00:19:01.900
It's not just like a flowing,
it's stop, turn around.

404
00:19:01.900 --> 00:19:05.893
Just like if you went into a corner,
I turned around looked at the wall.

405
00:19:05.893 --> 00:19:07.952
>> [LAUGH] [INAUDIBLE]
>> If you go into a corner,

406
00:19:07.952 --> 00:19:10.899
the only other option is to turn
around and go out the other way.

407
00:19:10.899 --> 00:19:15.727
So that's the whole idea of why we
called it a corner point is cuz it is

408
00:19:15.727 --> 00:19:18.200
changing the direction in there.

409
00:19:18.200 --> 00:19:21.540
And like you said, white arrow tool,
you always get it started.

410
00:19:21.540 --> 00:19:23.430
Don't worry about getting it exact.

411
00:19:23.430 --> 00:19:26.409
Yeah, we can talk about things
when we do the aligns, and

412
00:19:26.409 --> 00:19:28.283
the grades, and things like that.

413
00:19:28.283 --> 00:19:29.520
>> Right, measure tool will come in handy.

414
00:19:29.520 --> 00:19:30.470
>> Yeah all that.

415
00:19:30.470 --> 00:19:32.440
But it's really just get it in there.

416
00:19:32.440 --> 00:19:36.026
Use the white arrow and go back to
it because that's what I always do.

417
00:19:36.026 --> 00:19:37.062
>> Yeah.
Get it down,

418
00:19:37.062 --> 00:19:39.920
edit it out, and then move along.

419
00:19:39.920 --> 00:19:42.549
>> Yeah, yeah, and then just be like
okay that's close enough, right?

420
00:19:42.549 --> 00:19:43.500
[LAUGH].

421
00:19:43.500 --> 00:19:44.300
So we're gonna go ahead here.

422
00:19:44.300 --> 00:19:46.400
I want to show one last example.

423
00:19:46.400 --> 00:19:51.666
Just to show you kind of what you
can do with those corner points.

424
00:19:51.666 --> 00:19:54.424
Basically, what am I going to do if
I want to mix straight paths and

425
00:19:54.424 --> 00:19:55.465
curved paths, right?

426
00:19:55.465 --> 00:19:57.620
Okay, so you're not always going
to have the exact same thing.

427
00:19:57.620 --> 00:20:00.970
So, what I'm going to do, I'm just
gonna kind of blend the two together.

428
00:20:00.970 --> 00:20:03.346
So, I'm gonna click, hold,
and drag up, let go.

429
00:20:03.346 --> 00:20:05.420
Click, hold, drag down, let go.

430
00:20:05.420 --> 00:20:07.750
Click, hold, drag up, let go.

431
00:20:07.750 --> 00:20:11.400
Now, it's like, okay, maybe now I'll make
a corner point or something similar to it.

432
00:20:11.400 --> 00:20:13.610
So I've let go of my mouse, jazz hands.

433
00:20:13.610 --> 00:20:16.561
Never thought I'd say jazz hands so
much when I came here today.

434
00:20:16.561 --> 00:20:17.760
>> [LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH] So I can go ahead.

435
00:20:17.760 --> 00:20:21.360
I'm gonna hold down the ALT or OPTION key
and then now, rather than dragging this

436
00:20:21.360 --> 00:20:24.970
down to meet its friend to create another
hub going down, what I'm gonna do,

437
00:20:24.970 --> 00:20:28.480
I'm gonna remember that principle of
always knowing where I wanna go next.

438
00:20:28.480 --> 00:20:30.160
And maybe now I just wanna
have a straight line.

439
00:20:30.160 --> 00:20:31.980
So I'm gonna drag that
handlebar that way and

440
00:20:31.980 --> 00:20:34.786
you see now it's pointing
at a 90 degree angle.

441
00:20:34.786 --> 00:20:35.509
So you'd note,

442
00:20:35.509 --> 00:20:40.100
you're not just limited to just corners,
just know where you want to go next.

443
00:20:40.100 --> 00:20:46.010
>> And this is another one where a lot of
people want to take that bezier handle and

444
00:20:46.010 --> 00:20:49.800
drag it out, because it kind of
looks like a ball at the end, and

445
00:20:49.800 --> 00:20:51.160
that's where I want my next point.

446
00:20:51.160 --> 00:20:54.310
No, you just send it in the direction.

447
00:20:54.310 --> 00:20:55.720
Cuz that's what this is doing.

448
00:20:55.720 --> 00:20:59.490
It's just a directional signal,
if you wanna say.

449
00:20:59.490 --> 00:21:04.640
It's when you made that next point that
it's gonna connect straight across.

450
00:21:04.640 --> 00:21:05.940
>> Right, right, exactly.

451
00:21:05.940 --> 00:21:07.580
So I've got that straight, okay,

452
00:21:07.580 --> 00:21:10.704
I knew that that bezier handle needed
to be going in that direction.

453
00:21:10.704 --> 00:21:11.920
So that's what I wanted to work with.

454
00:21:11.920 --> 00:21:15.430
Now I have a straight path, but
I don't have a Bezier handle.

455
00:21:15.430 --> 00:21:18.230
How can I kind of create
something curved out of this?

456
00:21:18.230 --> 00:21:20.969
All you have to do,
you just kind of select,

457
00:21:20.969 --> 00:21:25.355
see if I hover over my point there,
what I'll see is I get that anchor.

458
00:21:25.355 --> 00:21:30.633
Or I'm sorry, the pen tool with sort
of like a mini anchor point tool,

459
00:21:30.633 --> 00:21:32.880
kind of had there as the tail.

460
00:21:32.880 --> 00:21:35.579
So you get the pen tool with
the little v next to it basically.

461
00:21:35.579 --> 00:21:40.015
And what you can do is from there when
I see that I can just click, hold, and

462
00:21:40.015 --> 00:21:40.598
drag up.

463
00:21:40.598 --> 00:21:42.780
And that's gonna give me
a bezier handle to work with.

464
00:21:42.780 --> 00:21:46.820
So now, I can make that a curve again and

465
00:21:46.820 --> 00:21:50.810
I can go back and
maybe now I want to go in this way.

466
00:21:50.810 --> 00:21:53.720
So I'll do that again,
click, hold, and drag down.

467
00:21:53.720 --> 00:21:55.932
Oops, got that one a little messed up.

468
00:21:55.932 --> 00:21:58.680
That's okay, we'll start over.

469
00:21:59.930 --> 00:22:01.350
I got myself all wonky here.

470
00:22:01.350 --> 00:22:02.300
I'm just gonna start over.

471
00:22:02.300 --> 00:22:02.930
There we go.
>> [LAUGH]

472
00:22:02.930 --> 00:22:04.270
>> We can always adjust

473
00:22:04.270 --> 00:22:06.080
with the white arrow tool later, right?

474
00:22:06.080 --> 00:22:08.580
So we can go to that,
click, hold and drag.

475
00:22:08.580 --> 00:22:11.550
Maybe now I wanna go straight here.

476
00:22:11.550 --> 00:22:18.862
Do whatever you need to do to be
able to adjust things as you need.

477
00:22:18.862 --> 00:22:20.835
>> Yeah, now-
>> I just had to prove to myself that I

478
00:22:20.835 --> 00:22:21.500
could do that.

479
00:22:21.500 --> 00:22:22.449
>> [LAUGH]
>> [CROSSTALK] was not working for me.

480
00:22:22.449 --> 00:22:25.829
[LAUGH]
>> As you're demonstrating, practice,

481
00:22:25.829 --> 00:22:26.820
keep on going.

482
00:22:26.820 --> 00:22:30.560
Just hey,
just know that you can go back and edit.

483
00:22:30.560 --> 00:22:32.580
Cuz we know we have our add and delete.

484
00:22:32.580 --> 00:22:36.030
We have our convert,
anchor point tool to go back and

485
00:22:36.030 --> 00:22:38.150
break the Bézier handles and everything.

486
00:22:38.150 --> 00:22:41.950
Get it down and
then you can edit it later.

487
00:22:41.950 --> 00:22:45.445
And as a little other side note,
that previewing,

488
00:22:45.445 --> 00:22:49.048
it's called the Rubber Band Preview.

489
00:22:49.048 --> 00:22:51.250
>> Yes.
>> I kind of like that name, yeah.

490
00:22:51.250 --> 00:22:58.890
>> And it is in the Preferences, and
in the Select and Anchor Display tab.

491
00:22:58.890 --> 00:23:00.609
So that's where we need to go.

492
00:23:00.609 --> 00:23:01.979
Yup, there you go.

493
00:23:01.979 --> 00:23:03.882
>> Selection and Anchor Display.

494
00:23:03.882 --> 00:23:06.863
>> And then it should be a rubber band,
something rubber band.

495
00:23:06.863 --> 00:23:09.921
>> Yup, enable rubber band for
the pen tool and the curvature tool.

496
00:23:09.921 --> 00:23:10.697
The curvature tool's fun.

497
00:23:10.697 --> 00:23:12.360
>> [LAUGH]
>> Yeah.

498
00:23:12.360 --> 00:23:15.378
If you're not loving the pen tool,
you're gonna like the curvature tool.

499
00:23:15.378 --> 00:23:15.952
>> [LAUGH]
>> Yea.

500
00:23:15.952 --> 00:23:16.980
[LAUGH]
>> Just to

501
00:23:16.980 --> 00:23:20.780
complete that thought of me saying
I don't like that preview thing.

502
00:23:20.780 --> 00:23:24.070
It's called the rubber band and
you can turn it off.

503
00:23:24.070 --> 00:23:27.305
And if you wanna be old and bold like me.

504
00:23:27.305 --> 00:23:30.828
>> [LAUGH] I was gonna say,
I'm like, I'm not turning it off.

505
00:23:30.828 --> 00:23:33.133
>> [LAUGH]
>> I'm gonna close that back down,

506
00:23:33.133 --> 00:23:34.590
forget I ever saw it.

507
00:23:34.590 --> 00:23:38.272
>> [CROSSTALK] Bad self, I'll be over
here making it easier for myself.

508
00:23:38.272 --> 00:23:40.460
[LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH] So you have a pen tool.

509
00:23:40.460 --> 00:23:44.220
I would say, we would both agree, just
practice, that's all it comes down to.

510
00:23:44.220 --> 00:23:46.150
You're gonna screw it up.

511
00:23:46.150 --> 00:23:47.340
Just like I did here.

512
00:23:47.340 --> 00:23:50.610
You saw, it's even still now I've
been using this for years and

513
00:23:50.610 --> 00:23:52.320
it's still kind of can
trip you up sometimes.

514
00:23:52.320 --> 00:23:54.190
So just remember practice.

515
00:23:54.190 --> 00:23:55.340
You can always go back.

516
00:23:55.340 --> 00:23:56.970
Just kind of get where you're going,
start it.

517
00:23:56.970 --> 00:23:59.490
You can always go back and
edit and fix things later.

518
00:23:59.490 --> 00:24:01.703
>> Well I thought that
was quite enjoyable.

519
00:24:01.703 --> 00:24:03.161
[LAUGH] I loved that episode.

520
00:24:03.161 --> 00:24:04.420
>> [LAUGH] You're like it's so fun.

521
00:24:04.420 --> 00:24:06.158
I can just sit back and watch.

522
00:24:06.158 --> 00:24:07.554
>> I know.
[LAUGH] I'm over here,

523
00:24:07.554 --> 00:24:10.840
everything she's saying I'm like,
yep, that's how I would say it.

524
00:24:10.840 --> 00:24:12.038
That's how I would say it too.

525
00:24:12.038 --> 00:24:14.588
Like here, let me jump in and
give you my two cents too.

526
00:24:14.588 --> 00:24:21.100
So it's kind of fun as like as your former
teacher as well way back in the day.

527
00:24:21.100 --> 00:24:25.116
It was just like one of those, aw,
I'm having a proud moment right now.

528
00:24:25.116 --> 00:24:28.801
>> Yeah, I feel like wax on and
wax off, whatever that, you know.

529
00:24:28.801 --> 00:24:31.342
[LAUGH] The student becomes the master or
whatever.

530
00:24:31.342 --> 00:24:34.654
>> Yes, okay now if we keep talking
about this I'm gonna start start crying.

531
00:24:34.654 --> 00:24:35.953
So we should probably stop.

532
00:24:35.953 --> 00:24:38.190
All right lets go ahead and
wrap this one up.

533
00:24:38.190 --> 00:24:41.830
Signing off for Creative Pro TV,
I've been your host Vonne Smith

534
00:24:41.830 --> 00:24:42.923
>> And I'm Emily Ramsey

535
00:24:42.923 --> 00:24:43.758
>> And we'll see you soon.

536
00:24:43.758 --> 00:24:52.499
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: Emily and Vonne show how to use the curvature tool - the cousin to the pen tool.
episodes.title: The Curvature Tool
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.415 --> 00:00:07.099
[SOUND]

2
00:00:07.099 --> 00:00:11.340
[MUSIC]

3
00:00:11.340 --> 00:00:15.276
Hello, and welcome back to another
exciting episode of CreativeProTV.

4
00:00:15.276 --> 00:00:20.174
I'm your host, Vonne Smith, and
this is Illustrator CC 2017.

5
00:00:20.174 --> 00:00:23.689
In this episode we're gonna talk
about the curvature tool, and

6
00:00:23.689 --> 00:00:25.416
it's a fun little tool [LAUGH].

7
00:00:25.416 --> 00:00:26.474
>> [LAUGH]
>> And here to help

8
00:00:26.474 --> 00:00:28.654
us with all the funness
is Miss Emily Ramsey.

9
00:00:28.654 --> 00:00:29.820
Hi.
>> Hi funness.

10
00:00:29.820 --> 00:00:30.655
>> Yeah.
>> [LAUGH]

11
00:00:30.655 --> 00:00:31.294
>> I don't know if

12
00:00:31.294 --> 00:00:35.020
anyone's ever referred to me in that way,
that I bring the fun, but yeah.

13
00:00:35.020 --> 00:00:36.830
I'm glad, I'm glad I can for you.

14
00:00:36.830 --> 00:00:38.620
So yes, the curvature Ttool.

15
00:00:38.620 --> 00:00:42.280
Curvature tool, super fun, basically why?

16
00:00:42.280 --> 00:00:46.900
Because if you hated creating curves
in the pen tool, if you didn't

17
00:00:46.900 --> 00:00:50.630
like those bezier handles, the curvature
tool is gonna be your friend.

18
00:00:50.630 --> 00:00:54.044
It's basically Illustrator's answer that
they've come up with in the past couple

19
00:00:54.044 --> 00:00:55.630
of years for people who've been like,

20
00:00:55.630 --> 00:00:58.917
I just can't figure out these bezier
handles, and it doesn't make sense to me.

21
00:00:58.917 --> 00:01:02.270
It's kind of like
a cousin of the pen tool.

22
00:01:02.270 --> 00:01:04.220
It's going to work in
somewhat of a similar method.

23
00:01:04.220 --> 00:01:09.690
You'll even see that the cursors,
the icons look pretty similar, but

24
00:01:09.690 --> 00:01:12.740
it's just gonna be one,

25
00:01:12.740 --> 00:01:17.670
a little bit easier [LAUGH] and two,
not quite as precise as the pen tool.

26
00:01:17.670 --> 00:01:22.250
So you do kinda have that to balance with,
but I just think it's kinda fun.

27
00:01:22.250 --> 00:01:25.210
So, I'm gonna go ahead and
grab my curvature tool.

28
00:01:25.210 --> 00:01:27.050
Same thing when we use our pen tool,

29
00:01:27.050 --> 00:01:30.990
I wanna make sure that I have no fill
selected and that I have a stroke applied.

30
00:01:30.990 --> 00:01:34.140
So I'm just doing the same thing,
I've got that slash through there, and

31
00:01:34.140 --> 00:01:38.010
then I have just my bright friend
orange that we're working with here.

32
00:01:38.010 --> 00:01:40.610
And with the curvature tool I'd say
let's just go ahead and click around.

33
00:01:40.610 --> 00:01:45.962
So I'm just gonna click up down,
up down, up down, up down.

34
00:01:45.962 --> 00:01:49.202
And you'll see rather than working
with those bezier handles,

35
00:01:49.202 --> 00:01:52.310
I'm not really thinking about
where I need to go next.

36
00:01:52.310 --> 00:01:59.900
I'm kind of just creating curves
wherever I went ahead and

37
00:01:59.900 --> 00:02:01.790
clicked down on the page there.

38
00:02:01.790 --> 00:02:04.926
And then you'll see that, what I just
started was called the rubber band.

39
00:02:04.926 --> 00:02:05.720
>> Yes.

40
00:02:05.720 --> 00:02:11.582
>> Yes, yes you'll see how that will kind
of guide you to where you're going next.

41
00:02:11.582 --> 00:02:15.013
So, you can see the difference if you
think back to that pen tool example when

42
00:02:15.013 --> 00:02:17.760
we did the up and down,
the up and down and up and down.

43
00:02:17.760 --> 00:02:19.100
It was much more precise.

44
00:02:19.100 --> 00:02:21.100
Now we can add to this and

45
00:02:21.100 --> 00:02:24.870
we can certainly make it look a little bit
more precise than what I'm doing here.

46
00:02:24.870 --> 00:02:26.410
But you see it's kind
of a different effect.

47
00:02:26.410 --> 00:02:29.400
>> Yeah well, and I honestly had
kind of forgotten about this tool.

48
00:02:29.400 --> 00:02:33.710
And as soon as you started, I was,
this is that wonderful kind of

49
00:02:33.710 --> 00:02:38.400
marriage between the pen tool,
which you're clicking, you're almost,

50
00:02:38.400 --> 00:02:42.260
like moving your mouse around and
where you're clicking the points and

51
00:02:42.260 --> 00:02:47.180
letting Illustrator do all
the hard work in between.

52
00:02:47.180 --> 00:02:49.391
>> Right.
>> This is one I'd definitely not turn

53
00:02:49.391 --> 00:02:53.416
off the rubber band preview because
otherwise I wouldn't have any idea what's

54
00:02:53.416 --> 00:02:54.208
going on here.

55
00:02:54.208 --> 00:02:57.702
>> Right, you do, I do find it to be
pretty necessary that you have that rubber

56
00:02:57.702 --> 00:03:00.540
band preview on,
especially as you're getting used to it.

57
00:03:00.540 --> 00:03:04.910
Now I will say, kinda to your point
being accustomed to bézier handles.

58
00:03:04.910 --> 00:03:06.500
When I first started using this,

59
00:03:06.500 --> 00:03:09.640
the curvature tool didn't exist,
back in the day.

60
00:03:09.640 --> 00:03:13.182
And so it kinda took me
a while to kinda get situated.

61
00:03:13.182 --> 00:03:15.302
Now, this may be the way you're starting,

62
00:03:15.302 --> 00:03:19.410
you may be like great, glad I didn't
have to go through those times.

63
00:03:19.410 --> 00:03:21.800
And so
what I would just suggest to you again,

64
00:03:21.800 --> 00:03:25.050
make sure you have that kind of rubber
band turned on, we talked about.

65
00:03:25.050 --> 00:03:29.120
It's available in your Preferences if you
didn't watch the episode where we were

66
00:03:29.120 --> 00:03:30.290
talking about the pen tool.

67
00:03:30.290 --> 00:03:33.230
Illustrator > Preferences > Selection and
Anchor Display.

68
00:03:33.230 --> 00:03:35.890
I just see all the way to the bottom
that enable rubber band [INAUDIBLE].

69
00:03:35.890 --> 00:03:38.670
Make sure you have it turned on for
the curvature tool.

70
00:03:38.670 --> 00:03:43.750
And that's gonna give you that kind of
line that tells you where you are going.

71
00:03:43.750 --> 00:03:48.700
But one of the wonderful things
about the curvature tool

72
00:03:48.700 --> 00:03:50.950
is that I can edit within this tool.

73
00:03:50.950 --> 00:03:55.880
So if I save and [INAUDIBLE], if I say
you know what, I don't really like that.

74
00:03:55.880 --> 00:03:59.027
I can just go over here, move that around.

75
00:03:59.027 --> 00:04:02.158
You'll see as I'm hovering over the path
I also get that little plus sign,

76
00:04:02.158 --> 00:04:04.340
you guys are kind of
familiar with that now.

77
00:04:04.340 --> 00:04:08.230
Kind of that add anchor point,
basically the same thing.

78
00:04:08.230 --> 00:04:11.400
I'm getting that plus sign,
I can go ahead and add something there.

79
00:04:11.400 --> 00:04:12.370
And I can be like, you know what,

80
00:04:12.370 --> 00:04:15.170
I want this to look a little bit more,
kinda like that.

81
00:04:15.170 --> 00:04:18.340
You see how that kind of converts
it to more of that style.

82
00:04:18.340 --> 00:04:21.670
From the episode with the pen tool,
we had those kind of perfect curves.

83
00:04:21.670 --> 00:04:26.200
You can see how it's like,
okay I can kinda go ahead and use this and

84
00:04:26.200 --> 00:04:27.350
make something.

85
00:04:27.350 --> 00:04:30.370
Maybe I'll add some points here.

86
00:04:30.370 --> 00:04:31.454
Do what you need to do.

87
00:04:31.454 --> 00:04:32.802
Yadda yadda yadda.

88
00:04:32.802 --> 00:04:36.295
And then you can start creating some
little bumps that start to look a little

89
00:04:36.295 --> 00:04:38.480
bit more similar to what you're doing.

90
00:04:38.480 --> 00:04:41.090
And just so nice that you can edit.

91
00:04:41.090 --> 00:04:42.170
>> And you're still going.

92
00:04:42.170 --> 00:04:43.530
Like you haven't stopped your pad.

93
00:04:43.530 --> 00:04:47.860
Like if you move your mouse, you can
keep on curving around and do whatever.

94
00:04:47.860 --> 00:04:48.865
Ooh.

95
00:04:48.865 --> 00:04:50.350
>> Yeah.

96
00:04:50.350 --> 00:04:53.790
Now the one thing that I find kind of
annoying is that it constantly wants you

97
00:04:53.790 --> 00:04:54.610
to close.

98
00:04:54.610 --> 00:04:58.560
So no matter what I'm doing,
even though I'm kind of in an edit mode,

99
00:04:58.560 --> 00:05:02.440
I always have that little rubber band as
much as I've been talking about how great

100
00:05:02.440 --> 00:05:05.820
the rubber band is, sometimes it does
kind of feel like it gets in my way.

101
00:05:05.820 --> 00:05:09.580
So that's the only little downside to
that, at least for me cuz it's like

102
00:05:09.580 --> 00:05:12.340
sometimes I'll be over here and
it's like no I just wanna edit that one.

103
00:05:12.340 --> 00:05:13.830
I didn't want to close it,

104
00:05:13.830 --> 00:05:16.560
which Illustrator's pretty good about
being able to tell the difference there.

105
00:05:16.560 --> 00:05:20.400
But that is something that you
want to maybe pay attention to,

106
00:05:20.400 --> 00:05:23.350
hopefully it won't annoy
you like it does me.

107
00:05:23.350 --> 00:05:25.660
Now you maybe like okay
well this is great but

108
00:05:25.660 --> 00:05:27.860
I can only create curved paths with it.

109
00:05:27.860 --> 00:05:30.365
So how helpful is that really.

110
00:05:30.365 --> 00:05:33.834
Cuz in most cases in reality we're
gonna have a mix of the two,

111
00:05:33.834 --> 00:05:37.600
you can create a mix of the two,
either upon drawing, or editing.

112
00:05:37.600 --> 00:05:38.382
So what we're gonna do,

113
00:05:38.382 --> 00:05:41.700
we have two different options for
creating a straight path.

114
00:05:41.700 --> 00:05:45.890
One, I can double click, so
if I double click either, again,

115
00:05:45.890 --> 00:05:48.400
as I'm creating something
you're editing later.

116
00:05:48.400 --> 00:05:51.490
By double-click that's gonna
create a straight path forming.

117
00:05:51.490 --> 00:05:54.430
The other option that you have and
I'll just do some curves in between.

118
00:05:54.430 --> 00:05:58.284
The other option that I have is to Alt or
Option click.

119
00:05:58.284 --> 00:06:01.747
So if I Alt or Option click, you can even
see this is one of those situations where

120
00:06:01.747 --> 00:06:04.501
Illustrator kind of gives you
the information on your cursor.

121
00:06:04.501 --> 00:06:08.677
As I'm holding down my ALT key, I see that
curvature tool with slash that's gonna let

122
00:06:08.677 --> 00:06:10.939
me know, okay, I'm making a straight path,

123
00:06:10.939 --> 00:06:14.535
which is slightly different from
the symbol that they use in other tools.

124
00:06:14.535 --> 00:06:16.649
So that's just one thing
to pay attention to.

125
00:06:16.649 --> 00:06:19.509
But now I can curve, curve,
curve, curve, curve, close.

126
00:06:19.509 --> 00:06:22.134
What if I want to edit one of these,
what if I need to go back and

127
00:06:22.134 --> 00:06:25.380
actually I want this one to be be curved,
just double-click on it again and

128
00:06:25.380 --> 00:06:26.850
it will flip it.

129
00:06:26.850 --> 00:06:27.637
>> Sorry.
>> [LAUGH]

130
00:06:27.637 --> 00:06:28.260
>> Woah.

131
00:06:28.260 --> 00:06:31.414
>> [LAUGH]
>> And you're still in the curvature tool?

132
00:06:31.414 --> 00:06:31.917
>> Exactly.
>> So

133
00:06:31.917 --> 00:06:36.030
I'm like she's gonna go to the anchor
point tool or go back to the white.

134
00:06:36.030 --> 00:06:38.150
No, same tool.

135
00:06:38.150 --> 00:06:41.910
Double click, that will change from
straight to curve, curve to straight.

136
00:06:41.910 --> 00:06:42.700
>> Exactly.

137
00:06:42.700 --> 00:06:45.510
They have taken out the need for

138
00:06:45.510 --> 00:06:50.835
all those other tools basically,
which is really pretty cool.

139
00:06:50.835 --> 00:06:51.420
>> Wow!

140
00:06:51.420 --> 00:06:55.130
>> Yeah, yeah, so like this, it's curved.

141
00:06:55.130 --> 00:06:56.560
I'm gonna go ahead and double-click.

142
00:06:56.560 --> 00:06:58.090
It will go ahead and make it straight.

143
00:06:58.090 --> 00:07:01.010
>> And if you double-click that straight
point that you just made again.

144
00:07:01.010 --> 00:07:02.464
>> Make it curved.

145
00:07:02.464 --> 00:07:02.997
>> Okay!

146
00:07:02.997 --> 00:07:04.810
>> Yes, or Alt or Option-click.

147
00:07:04.810 --> 00:07:08.000
You are not limited to just
double-clicking Alt or Option-click.

148
00:07:08.000 --> 00:07:13.210
And again that's when I say, it's either
upon creation or while you're editing and

149
00:07:13.210 --> 00:07:19.030
when I say editing I mean editing
with the curvature tool itself.

150
00:07:19.030 --> 00:07:21.120
So up down, up down, up down.

151
00:07:21.120 --> 00:07:24.560
Double click, double click, double
click or maybe I wanna go back here.

152
00:07:24.560 --> 00:07:26.190
Didn't leave the curvature tool.

153
00:07:26.190 --> 00:07:26.820
Double click.

154
00:07:26.820 --> 00:07:28.400
I wanna go ahead and make that straight.

155
00:07:28.400 --> 00:07:31.291
Double click I want to go ahead and
make that straight so.

156
00:07:31.291 --> 00:07:32.425
>> Wow.

157
00:07:32.425 --> 00:07:36.088
I am pretty impressed right now.

158
00:07:36.088 --> 00:07:36.663
>> I know.

159
00:07:36.663 --> 00:07:37.719
I live to impress.

160
00:07:37.719 --> 00:07:39.862
>> [LAUGH]
>> And

161
00:07:39.862 --> 00:07:42.406
you can go back to the wide arrow tool.

162
00:07:42.406 --> 00:07:44.641
>> Yeah.
>> You can even go to the smooth tool that

163
00:07:44.641 --> 00:07:45.898
we looked at.

164
00:07:45.898 --> 00:07:47.332
>> Yeah.

165
00:07:47.332 --> 00:07:48.366
It is still an option.

166
00:07:49.528 --> 00:07:50.405
>> Wow.

167
00:07:50.405 --> 00:07:54.270
Okay, I might be using this from now on.

168
00:07:54.270 --> 00:07:57.821
>> We were talking before, and
you were kinda like, yeah, whatever,

169
00:07:57.821 --> 00:07:58.934
the curvature tool.

170
00:07:58.934 --> 00:08:02.815
Okay, be that way.

171
00:08:02.815 --> 00:08:04.662
>> [LAUGH]
>> I think it's fantastic.

172
00:08:04.662 --> 00:08:07.614
I definitely think, especially if
you are just starting out, and

173
00:08:07.614 --> 00:08:11.040
you have no prior knowledge of the pen
tool, you're probably gonna be like,

174
00:08:11.040 --> 00:08:12.900
this is great, and hopefully, you are.

175
00:08:12.900 --> 00:08:14.050
Hopefully that's what you're thinking.

176
00:08:14.050 --> 00:08:20.600
So just to kind of wrap this up,
something that I wanted to show you with,

177
00:08:20.600 --> 00:08:24.980
going back to that episode we did with the
wide arrow tool, kind of the path editing.

178
00:08:24.980 --> 00:08:28.810
And we showed the example of how to
take a circle and convert it to a heart.

179
00:08:28.810 --> 00:08:32.010
I just wanted to show you,
kind of from another perspective,

180
00:08:32.010 --> 00:08:36.020
how we could draw a heart
with our curvature tool.

181
00:08:36.020 --> 00:08:38.250
So hopefully I can
remember this correctly,

182
00:08:38.250 --> 00:08:40.410
cuz it's not something that
I do on a day-to-day basis.

183
00:08:40.410 --> 00:08:43.070
But what we're gonna do, we're gonna go
ahead and start with a straight path.

184
00:08:43.070 --> 00:08:46.000
That's gonna be kind of the middle
point of our heart, the center.

185
00:08:46.000 --> 00:08:48.740
So I'm gonna double click
to create a straight path.

186
00:08:48.740 --> 00:08:53.960
Then I'm gonna single click, single click,
double click cuz I want that

187
00:08:53.960 --> 00:08:58.020
point at the end, and
then single click, single click.

188
00:08:58.020 --> 00:08:59.920
And then now here's only the tricky thing.

189
00:08:59.920 --> 00:09:01.800
Yes I need this to be a straight path, but

190
00:09:01.800 --> 00:09:04.340
I've already created
a straight path there.

191
00:09:04.340 --> 00:09:05.860
So I just need to single click.

192
00:09:05.860 --> 00:09:10.492
If I were to double click on that, it
would try and trade it to a curved path.

193
00:09:10.492 --> 00:09:11.675
So that's the one little trick,

194
00:09:11.675 --> 00:09:15.430
as you do need to be aware when you
are connecting two, how it is set up.

195
00:09:15.430 --> 00:09:18.035
>> Because you already designated
it as a straight point when you

196
00:09:18.035 --> 00:09:19.540
double-clicked it to start.

197
00:09:19.540 --> 00:09:21.016
>> Exactly
>> All right.

198
00:09:21.016 --> 00:09:22.910
>> Yes, so
it's kinda already thinking, okay,

199
00:09:22.910 --> 00:09:26.640
but this is already straight on
the other side, how that's gonna work.

200
00:09:26.640 --> 00:09:30.128
And the beautiful thing is like no
I did not make that perfectly but

201
00:09:30.128 --> 00:09:31.913
I can very easily edit this here.

202
00:09:31.913 --> 00:09:34.949
And I'll even swap so
that you see my fill color and

203
00:09:34.949 --> 00:09:39.502
it's like hey that was easier than taking,
I think in my case a circle, and

204
00:09:39.502 --> 00:09:41.998
then kind of converting that down to it.

205
00:09:41.998 --> 00:09:44.966
So I think it's kind of fun,
it's kind of interesting and

206
00:09:44.966 --> 00:09:49.209
there are certainly some good tutorials if
you look elsewhere online whatever that

207
00:09:49.209 --> 00:09:52.618
can kind of show you some other
options that you can make with this.

208
00:09:52.618 --> 00:09:55.720
>> [CROSSTALK]
>> Wow, seriously I'm listening.

209
00:09:55.720 --> 00:09:57.344
>> [LAUGH].

210
00:09:57.344 --> 00:09:58.590
The student has become the teacher.

211
00:09:58.590 --> 00:09:59.791
[CROSSTALK]
>> [LAUGH]

212
00:09:59.791 --> 00:10:01.219
>> Teacher's become the student,

213
00:10:01.219 --> 00:10:01.936
it's amazing.

214
00:10:01.936 --> 00:10:07.251
This is why like these newer
features of Illustrator CC's

215
00:10:07.251 --> 00:10:11.383
2017 just make your life so much easier.

216
00:10:11.383 --> 00:10:12.722
>> Yeah.
>> So thank you so much for

217
00:10:12.722 --> 00:10:14.608
that wonderful episode
on the curvature tool.

218
00:10:14.608 --> 00:10:16.419
>> [LAUGH] I'm glad I could
make your life easier.

219
00:10:16.419 --> 00:10:17.938
>> [LAUGH].

220
00:10:17.938 --> 00:10:20.167
>> Cuz that's why I brought you here.

221
00:10:20.167 --> 00:10:24.050
>> [LAUGH]
>> Awesome, well thank you so much for

222
00:10:24.050 --> 00:10:24.580
that.

223
00:10:24.580 --> 00:10:27.910
But we're gonna go ahead and
wrap this episode up.

224
00:10:27.910 --> 00:10:29.370
Signing off for CREATIVEPRO.TV.

225
00:10:29.370 --> 00:10:30.780
I've been your host Vonne Smith.

226
00:10:30.780 --> 00:10:31.980
>> And I'm Emily Ramsey.

227
00:10:31.980 --> 00:10:33.736
>> And we'll see you soon.

228
00:10:33.736 --> 00:10:42.169
[MUSIC].

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Emily introduce different ways to align objects using the align panel, grids and guides, and smart guides.
episodes.title: Aligning Objects
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.012 --> 00:00:03.619
[SOUND]

2
